6.15 Debugger options

6.15.2 Exceptions options

The Exceptions page controls the action taken when a particular exception occurs in the thread. Use the Action list to select an action.

The possible actions are:

Ignore

Throw the exception away and allow the application to continue.

Report

Write the message into the debugger's interaction pane and continue.

Debug

Pause the application. Update the debugger for the thread that signalled the exception. Write the message into a log. Activate any other debugger panels, but without updating them automatically. Allow an arbitrary amount of debugging and continue executing the application once Application > Resume is selected.
